area_name: Way of the Alpine Buddha Boulder

content.description: This is a mix of three problems. Start and follow the Buddha Traverse until your far right on the obvious rail on some super positive holds (theres also a lower rail offering really stable feet), instead of going for the crimp, dyno up to a really large slightly sloping ledge that is far right on the West face, match hands then finish out the last part of Off the Beaten Path.
content.protection: Several pads are nice. The ground isnt flat so be ready to adjust the pads often.
content.location: Sit start lower left of the overhanging West face and finish upper right on the South face.

content.description:
Overhanging arete. Just around the corner, south and/or right, from the main overhanging face is a broken rail along with various pocket holds.  

  Stand start on a obvious horizontal lip that is on the main face, use good enough foot holds on the main overhanging face and south face to make your way up so you can throw to a vertical shallow crack high on the South face to the fun mantle top out.
content.protection: Some obstacles are around. A pad or two is nice.
content.location: Main overhanging face's south-west corner (when facing the main face its the overhanging corner/arete to your right).

content.description: Sit start far lower left of the West face, move vertical a couple of moves through a side pull and some positive holds, start traversing right on the obvious large flat to juggy holds to a nice positive rail, continue on the rail through a sweet crimp and end at the start of Off the Beaten Path.
content.location: West Face (obvious overhanging face of the boulder).

pathTokens: Way of the Alpine Buddha Boulder

content.description: Main face is west facing. Nicely overhanging for 10ft then goes vertical. Quality, solid stone with fun various features.
